title: A Multi-Task Approach to Robust Deep Reinforcement Learning for Resource Allocation. (arXiv:2304.12660v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: With increasing complexity of modern communication systems, machine learning algorithms have become a focal point of research. However, performance demands have tightened in parallel to complexity. For some of the key applications targeted by future wireless, such as the medical field, strict and reliable performance guarantees are essential, but vanilla machine learning methods have been shown to struggle with these types of requirements. Therefore, the question is raised whether these methods can be extended to better deal with the demands imposed by such applications. In this paper, we look at a combinatorial resource allocation challenge with rare, significant events which must be handled properly. We propose to treat this as a multi-task learning problem, select two methods from this domain, Elastic Weight Consolidation and Gradient Episodic Memory, and integrate them into a vanilla actor-critic scheduler.
